Syncthing.description:
Open Source Continuous File Synchronization, private, secure and easy to use.

Based on the custom docker image: https://hub.docker.com/r/linuxserver/syncthing, available for amd64 and arm64 architecture.

Note this containers uses the net=host option to enable local IP addresses to be discovered as well.

21027.description: Port for discovery broadcasts. You may need to open it(protocol: udp) on your firewall. Suggested default: 21027.
21027.label: Discovery port

22000.description: Port for incoming data. You may need to open it(protocol: tcp) on your firewall. Suggested default: 22000.
22000.label: Listening port

/config.description: Choose a Share for configuration. E.g.: create a Share called syncthing-config for this purpose alone. Minimum Size: 1 Gigabyte
/config.label: Config Storage

/config/Sync.description: Choose a Share for all incoming data. E.g.: create a Share called syncthing-data for this purpose alone. After the Rockon has been installed, additional shares can be added.
/config/Sync.label: Data Storage

PGID.description: Enter a valid GID to use along with the same UID. It(or the above UID) must have full permissions to all Shares mapped in the previous step.
PGID.label: GID

PUID.description: Enter a valid UID to run Syncthing with. It must have full permissions to all Shares mapped in the previous step.
PUID.label: UID
